intro: Xanthoceras enkianthiflorum, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
